explains: v. （用规则条例）控制，管理；调节，调整；监控，监管；校准，对准（时钟或其他仪器）

sentences.en: The FCC has no statutory authority to regulate the Internet.
sentences.cn: 美国联邦通信委员会没有规范因特网的法定权力。

sentences.en: Under such a plan, the government would regulate competition among insurance companies so that everyone gets care at lower cost.
sentences.cn: 根据这样一个计划，政府会控制保险公司之间的竞争，这样每个人都能以较低价格获得保险。

sentences.en: The government should regulate the app-based car rental market.
sentences.cn: 政府应规范以应用软件为基础的汽车租赁市场。
